member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.Compact.MetadataResolverHost
member.summary: In .NET Framework implementation this class handles the loading of OpenAccess assemblies in SRD's AppDomain. In .NET Standard 2.0 apps the design-time is not used. In .NET 6+ apps (SRD.NET, WRD, RS.NET) instead of OpenAccess assemblies, we use Telerik.OpenAccess, which is a .NET Standard 2.1 lame ripoff of OpenAccess assemblies.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.Compact.ObjectDataSourceParameter
member.summary: Used for JSON serialization

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ConnectionHelper.IsValidOpenEdgeConnection(System.Data.Odbc.OdbcFactory,System.String)
member.summary: Tries to read the count of system tables from the OpenEdge server and returns true if any.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.SchemaRestrictionsInfo
member.summary: Contains schema restriction information for database metadata queries. Extends ConnectionInfo with additional filtering capabilities for database schema operations.
member.remarks: Used by the query builder to apply specific restrictions when resolving database schema information such as tables, columns, and procedures.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.SchemaRestrictionsInfo.SchemaRestrictions
member.summary: Gets or sets the restrictions used to filter database schema metadata. Contains JSON or string-formatted restrictions that limit the scope of schema queries.
member.remarks: These restrictions are applied when querying database metadata to limit results to specific schemas, tables, or other database objects.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ConnectionInfo
member.summary: Contains essential database connection information for establishing data connections. Provides the core properties needed to connect to and identify database connections.
member.remarks: This class serves as a base for database connection operations throughout the Web Report Designer and reporting services.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ConnectionInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the database connection. Used for identification and display purposes in connection lists and user interfaces.
member.remarks: This is typically a user-friendly name that helps identify the connection in dropdowns and configuration screens.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ConnectionInfo.Provider
member.summary: Gets or sets the data provider name that specifies the database type. Determines which database driver and SQL dialect to use for the connection.
member.remarks: Common values include "System.Data.SqlClient" for SQL Server, "System.Data.OleDb" for OLE DB connections, and other provider-specific names.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ConnectionInfo.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string containing database connection parameters. Contains server location, credentials, database name, and other connection-specific settings.
member.remarks: This property is required and must contain all necessary information to establish a database connection including server, authentication, and database details.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DbProviderInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a data provider.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DbProviderInfo.Name
member.summary: Specifies the data provider name.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DbProviderInfo.Description
member.summary: Specifies the data provider description.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DefaultParameterNameProvider.GetParameterPrefix(Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DefaultParameterNameProvider.ParameterNameBuilder)
member.summary: Returns the parameter placeholder string for a parameter ordinal. NOTE: Respected is only the first character for easier comparison, because for MSSQL this method returns "@p0"

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.RootCategory
member.summary: Used for schema retrieval in WRD. TODO: Code duplication with Telerik.Reporting.Design.Common.ExpressionBuilder.CategoryAdapter.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.GenerateSqlInfo
member.summary: Contains the information required to generate SQL statements from the visual query designer state. Used to convert query designer configurations into executable SQL commands.
member.remarks: This class serves as a data transfer object for SQL generation services in the Web Report Designer's query builder.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.GenerateSqlInfo.ProviderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the data provider name that identifies the type of database connection. Used to determine the correct SQL syntax and dialect for the target database.
member.remarks: Specifies the database provider type (e.g., "System.Data.SqlClient", "System.Data.OleDb") for generating provider-specific SQL syntax.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.GenerateSqlInfo.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string used to establish the database connection. Contains all necessary parameters for connecting to the target database.
member.remarks: Holds the complete connection string with server information, credentials, and database parameters for schema validation and query testing.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.GenerateSqlInfo.QueryDesignerState
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON serialized state of the visual query designer. Contains the complete configuration of tables, fields, relations, and filters from the query builder interface.
member.remarks: Contains JSON representation of tables, field selections, relationships, and filter criteria that gets converted into SQL SELECT statements.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.Interactive.MetadataResolverHost
member.summary: In .NET Framework implementation this class handles the loading of OpenAccess assemblies in SRD's AppDomain. In .NET Standard 2.0 apps the design-time is not used. In .NET 6+ apps (SRD.NET, WRD, RS.NET) instead of OpenAccess assemblies, we use Telerik.OpenAccess, which is a .NET Standard 2.1 lame ripoff of OpenAccess assemblies.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DynamicAssemblyLoadContext
member.summary: Based on implementation from here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/11566

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.DataSourceMemberAdapter.ApplyFilter
member.summary: Only include members with DataObjectMethodAttribute applied

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver
member.summary: Represents a resolver that returns all types that can be used from the object data source and the model of their members.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver.IsInProcess
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the target types are available in the same application process.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver.GetTypeModel
member.summary: Gets all types suitable for DataSource.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver.GetDataMemberModel(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all members of a type suitable for DataMember.
member.param: Only include members with DataObjectMethodAttribute applied

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver.GetDataMemberModel(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all members of a type suitable for DataMember.
member.param: Only include members with DataObjectMethodAttribute applied.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver.GetDataModel(Telerik.Reporting.ObjectDataSource)
member.summary: Gets the data schema (fields) of a configured object data source.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.IObjectDataSourceTypesResolver.GetTypeMeasures(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the properties of the specified type.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ObjectDataSourceTypeHelper
member.summary: Helper methods to list Type-s as object data source

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.ObjectDataSourceInstanceHelper
member.summary: Helper methods to list instances (DataSet, etc.) as object data source

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.TypeInfo.ParentType
member.summary: From Type.DeclaringType

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.OdbcParameterNameProvider
member.summary: ODBC command doesn't support named parameters. It marks all the parameters with a "?" placeholder and access them sequentially.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.PreviewDataInfo
member.summary: Contains query information and row limit settings for data preview operations.
member.remarks: Used to limit the number of rows returned when previewing query results in the Web Report Designer.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.PreviewDataInfo.MaxRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of rows to return in preview operations.
member.remarks: This property is required and prevents large datasets from overwhelming the preview interface.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.PreviewDataInfoWithParameters
member.summary: Contains preview data information along with parameter values for parameterized queries.
member.remarks: Used when executing preview queries that require parameter values to be provided.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.PreviewDataInfoWithParameters.PreviewDataInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the preview data configuration including query and row limits.
member.remarks: This property is required and contains the base query information and preview settings.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.PreviewDataInfoWithParameters.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of parameter values for the query execution.
member.remarks: Contains the parameter names, values, and types needed to execute parameterized queries during preview.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfo
member.summary: Contains database query information including connection details and command configuration.
member.remarks: Extends ConnectionInfo with query-specific properties for SQL execution and timeout settings.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfo.SelectCommandType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of SQL command to execute (text or stored procedure).
member.remarks: Determines whether the SelectCommand property contains SQL text or a stored procedure name.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfo.SelectCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL command text or stored procedure name to execute.
member.remarks: This property is required and contains the actual SQL statement or procedure name for data retrieval.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfo.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the command timeout in seconds for query execution.
member.remarks: Specifies how long to wait for the query to execute before timing out, with zero indicating no timeout.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the QueryInfo class.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoWithParameters
member.summary: Contains query information along with parameter values for parameterized query execution.
member.remarks: Used when executing queries that require parameter values to be provided for proper execution.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoWithParameters.QueryInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the base query configuration including connection and command details.
member.remarks: This property is required and contains the core query information needed for execution.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoWithParameters.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of parameter values for the query execution.
member.remarks: Contains the parameter names, values, and database types needed to execute parameterized queries.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoParameter
member.summary: Represents a single parameter for database query execution with name, value, and type information.
member.remarks: Used to pass typed parameter values to parameterized SQL queries and stored procedures.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoParameter.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter name as it appears in the SQL query.
member.remarks: This property is required and must match the parameter name in the SQL command text or stored procedure.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoParameter.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter value to be passed to the query.
member.remarks: The value type should be compatible with the specified DbType for proper query execution.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Data.Schema.QueryInfoParameter.DbType
member.summary: Gets or sets the database type of the parameter for proper type conversion.
member.remarks: This property is required and ensures the parameter value is converted to the correct database type during execution.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Design.Common.ExpressionBuilder.DesignReportExpressionContext
member.summary: Used from the ExpressionBuilder. Those entries are design-time only and will lead to incorrect behavior if present at runtime.
